vulnerabilities.title: Command Injection in lodash
vulnerabilities.description: Lodash versions prior to 4.17.21 are vulnerable to Command Injection via the template function.

vulnerabilities.title: Prototype Pollution in lodash
vulnerabilities.description: Prototype pollution vulnerability in lodash before 4.17.19 allows attackers to modify Object.prototype.

vulnerabilities.title: CSRF Vulnerability in axios
vulnerabilities.description: Axios before 1.6.0 inadvertently exposes the confidential XSRF-TOKEN stored in cookies.

vulnerabilities.title: Server-Side Request Forgery in axios
vulnerabilities.description: Axios before 0.21.1 is vulnerable to SSRF via a crafted URL.

vulnerabilities.title: Prototype Pollution in minimist
vulnerabilities.description: Minimist before 1.2.6 is vulnerable to Prototype Pollution via the setKey function.

vulnerabilities.title: Exposure of Sensitive Information in node-fetch
vulnerabilities.description: node-fetch before 2.6.7 is vulnerable to exposure of sensitive information via cookies.

vulnerabilities.title: Open Redirect in express
vulnerabilities.description: Express before 4.19.2 is vulnerable to open redirect attacks via malformed URLs.

vulnerabilities.title: Insecure Default in jsonwebtoken
vulnerabilities.description: jsonwebtoken before 9.0.0 allows attackers to bypass secret validation via jwt.verify().

vulnerabilities.title: Command Injection in shell-quote
vulnerabilities.description: shell-quote before 1.7.3 is vulnerable to command injection via untrusted input.

vulnerabilities.title: ReDoS in moment
vulnerabilities.description: Moment.js before 2.29.4 is vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service.

vulnerabilities.title: Arbitrary File Creation in tar
vulnerabilities.description: tar before 6.1.9 is vulnerable to arbitrary file creation via symlink attacks.

vulnerabilities.title: ReDoS in semver
vulnerabilities.description: semver before 7.5.2 is vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service.

vulnerabilities.title: Prototype Pollution in qs
vulnerabilities.description: qs before 6.10.3 is vulnerable to Prototype Pollution via the parse function.

vulnerabilities.title: SSRF in got
vulnerabilities.description: got before 11.8.5 is vulnerable to server-side request forgery via redirect handling.

vulnerabilities.title: Prototype Pollution in json5
vulnerabilities.description: json5 before 2.2.2 is vulnerable to Prototype Pollution via the parse method.
